item.title: Evolutionary art experiment with Marilyn
item.description: You know I like evolutionary algorithms. In the past month I ran a small art experiment reflecting the impact of brands and the harmful effect of advertisements in modern life. The idea was to pick a cultural icon and recreate it using corporate logos only. I started with Marilyn Monroe and a genetic algorithm that combined a set of logos in a mutation and a crossover loop. The mutation phase randomly picked some individuals (an individual is a specific combination of logos) and modified them, as nature would do, replacing some logos, resizing or rotating them.

item.title: Evolutionary computation · TEFcon 2014
item.description: This is my presentation (spanish) about evolutionary computation for the TEFcon 2014. It was a talk about how we code and how genetic algorithms and genetic programming might help us. Because “programming should be more about the what and less about the how”. Edit: I’ve pushed the Java code for the queens problem using genetic algorithms to github.
